website_summaries.verdict: A strong contender for home use, though it is somewhat pricey.
pros: The body resists rust and corrosion
Smart engineering promotes efficient water use
cons: It may be better for home use than commercial use, as the overall hardiness of the product isn't as high-level as some other choices

customer_reviews.title: Light Duty Commercial Style, not Industrial.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a low priced, full tilt industrial mop bucket, this is NOT for you. I bought this for home use, I have about 1200 sq feet of linoleum flooring, and for that task, this is perfect. It would be ideal for small office restrooms, hair stylists, professional offices, waiting rooms. If you are looking for something for restaurant, production facilities, or other larger scale operations, this bucket and wringer will be too light duty to last very long. For that, step up to something labeled "industrial".... Pros: Light weight, maneuverable, quality no-mar wheels, functional design, easy pour to empty. Cons: Light weight.
customer_reviews.author: David Riker

customer_reviews.title: Quality bucket inproved with mop holder.
customer_reviews.text: Just tiled and needed a mop & bucket to clean with. For home use the 26 qt works better than the larger 35. Also cost less. Very good quality, sturdy build, rolls easily but the wringer only gets 4 stars. No place to hold mop so I added a mop holder to it. Works great. Bought at Home Depot for $1.98 ( Model # 24215) and installs in less than 5 minutes. Simply drill two pilot holes first and install. Very sturdy and a convenient place to store mop (dry first). Just be sure when mop is pulled out, rubber holder is straight across (pic 2)
customer_reviews.author: Norm  T

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if it is worth the amount you save.
customer_reviews.text: It is not that good at wringing, which is what I bought it for. The whole bucket flexes when you use the wringer. I have to put a foot on the rim just to make it half functional.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Robinson

customer_reviews.title: The box is beat up its like its been in combat and back and the item is missing some nuts..
customer_reviews.text: I got the item today and its missing a nut
customer_reviews.author: Earle

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this for a mop, I use it wring out my clothes, towels... after using a small washer that you hand crank and does not spin to get water out of stuff. It works just the way I had hoped! I can (and have) hung up clothes after wringing them out in this, inside as it's been raining outside and no wet mess from dripping clothes to have to clean up. I am quite happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KessaJo

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I definitely should have the description better. It's smaller than I anticipated however it wasn't misleading I was just a bonehead. That being said it's a great product looks awesome does its job. I came to find out the size fits my needs better than the larger one would have. All in all two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Jake K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my sister who struggles with knee and wrist pain. She loves to keep her house clean, but wringing her mop was very difficult for her. She absolutely LOVES this mop bucket and raves about it. Not too many people get excited about a mop bucket, but it made a huge difference to her and she really appreciated the gift!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa CoreyTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for home use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was smaller than a commercial unit. I think it is a perfect size for home use. Easier to store. I have tile in my kitchen, entryway and two baths. The product seems to be sturdy enough for home use. Assembly was no problem. You simply install the casters and place the pre-assembled wringer unit on the bucket, done. I would suggest once you have tapped in the 4 white plastic spacers into the bucket for the casters, you add a very slight amount of dish soap to the caster stem before you insert it into the plastic spacer. It will make installing the casters much easier. Overall very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Guy

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I got the first bucket, it was an Amazon warehouse deals item. It arrived broken. So I returned it and asked for another one. That one arrived broken too. So if this item can't even make it through the mail in one piece, how is it going to work well doing the actual job? Obviously this is poorly made, thin, flimsy garbage. Wish I hadn't wasted my time.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sizer

customer_reviews.title: Good for home
customer_reviews.text: Good homeowner quality, but I could see an employee breaking it quick. The pivot is weak, you can see if flex. If you bought it and want it to last you won't jam it down.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Very good for the price. My husband and I went to shop around stores for janitorial supplies Particularly for a mop bucket this size. and they where very overpriced. So we decided to order it from Amazon and are glad we did. It is a perfect size for a small building. Very sturdy and works well. Highly recommend if you need a small commercial mop bucket .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice bucket to have as a homeowner
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have one, honestly you need one. A toilet hangs up just one time at 2am, and you wake up at 7:00 with a "squish" stepping out of bed. 20 feet from that toilet. You hear the well running, and think nothing of it really, until your wife says "the hot water doesn't seem...." and she fades away as you sprint down the hall horrified that....yep.....again "squish". Water heater's gone bad, and dribbling a gallon a minute for 2 hours. These both happened to me. Trust me, you will wish you had a quality mop and bucket.
customer_reviews.author: D.K

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: The Box that this came in was absolutely trashed! The actual bucket is totally fine, surprisingly. The wringer is strong and sturdy. The wheels are so smooth on the floor, rolling it around is effortless.
customer_reviews.author: Emily H.

customer_reviews.title: Love my new mop bucket
customer_reviews.text: Love my new mop bucket! This bucket wheels around our (home) tiled flooring very easily. Bucket isn't so large that you waste water. I cannot use the wringer due to thin microfiber mop I use. This is not a deal breaker for me. The wringer sits up high enough that I just hand wring my mop in the wringer area with no mess or splatter on floor. This mop bucket has made my mopping days a lot easier!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted for my condo balcony
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my condo balconys. Tired of using a bucket and wringing mop by hand and hate using sponge mops on th balcony, This isn’t a robust product. It is lightweight and I don’t think suitable for a schools janitors closet. I have one of those at my home- but that’s ok, what I wanted. I needed a smaller lighter unit that stores well in a condo where storage is at a premium. This works well, is EXACTLY what I wanted, price point was right on. Just don’t manhandle or really muscle it.
customer_reviews.author: JoeSmo

customer_reviews.title: Great heavy duty mop bucket and wringer
customer_reviews.text: Have been going through mops like crazy... I love a clean house and the others kept breaking. Especially ones that had the foot pedal to spin. So i just decided to go more old fashion and heavy duty. I got a small bucket size since it is only for a residential use and it is perfect. Rolls around great and the mop wringer works well. Only thing I don't like is that it is not as small as the normal house mop and buckets so storage is more bulky, so I just keep it in the garage. It will last me a long long time.
customer_reviews.author: Elisa

customer_reviews.title: Came broken
customer_reviews.text: It came broken. The metal piece under the bucket where you squeeze the mop is not attached to the bucket so it doesn't squeeze the mop.
customer_reviews.author: Shanu

customer_reviews.title: Beware this bucket is not normal size its smaller
customer_reviews.text: This mop bucket is much smaller it only holds 3-4 gallons of water.
customer_reviews.author: mike tucker

customer_reviews.title: Broken in one month
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the business. Because it said It's commercial quality. I thought this may be very sturdy and will last for a while. After I received this. I was little disappointed. It made with cheap plastic the handle looks very fragile and easy to broken. After one month of used. The spinner inside of the basket is falling off and the handle is broken into 2 pieces. Very cheap product and bad quality. Keep away from it.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Good household mop bucket; fun colors
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I am working at a hazmat site using this bright red mop bucket. I think I am gonna put racing stripes on it, or maybe some cool stickers. Facts: smaller than a commercial mop bucket. Made of pretty strong stuff. Casters pressure fit into plastic frame, and have not fallen out in half a year of use.
customer_reviews.author: MossHerder

customer_reviews.title: A Forty Five Dollar Mistake!
customer_reviews.text: The bucket arrived cracked. I couldn’t tell until I filled it with water and cleaning solution and it spilled all over the floor. I was unable to return it so I sealed it with marine glue which worked well until this the 6th month when it began leaking likely from somewhere else. It was easy to use when it wasn’t leaking and the wringer portion did a great job but alas having a leak in a mop bucket points to poor construction and/or mishandling during shipping. A refund or replacement would have been nice.
customer_reviews.author: JGG

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Have puppy that is still peeing on the tile floor. I load my bucket every morning with bleach water and it's ready for my little accidents all day long. Moves around my tile floor with ease. Light weight enough I can carry up and down the steps with no problem. This system is a smaller version then what you would see in a school or office but it's perfect for home use. You wont be dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: mom101

customer_reviews.title: I also read that it tipped easily and was not heavy duty enough
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this product. In other reviews I read that assembly was difficult and there were not instructions. I also read that it tipped easily and was not heavy duty enough. There were instructions and it was easy to assemble. The product itself is well made and user friendly. I don't think it is necessarily industrial grade but certainly works well for small business or a large home. It has made my life much easier.
customer_reviews.author: PJ Robinson

customer_reviews.title: right tool for the job ! love it bright red
customer_reviews.text: well, i am going to be mopping a huge concrete floor, so i might as well be equips with the right tool for the job. Work doesn't feel like work when you've got the right tool. such a great price too. its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: SHERRY LOVESamazon

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had mop buckets before I really don’t like this one the water comes out through the back When you’re trying to ring the mod and falls all over the floor so just makes a bigger mess it was not made well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, wheels do not turn easily!
customer_reviews.text: Maneuverability is horrible. I use it on a janitorial cart. Thats the only reason why I'm keeping it otherwise I would of sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Yellow bucket
customer_reviews.text: After using walmart buckets and accessories, I knew I needed a true legend of a mop bucket. This mop bucket gets the job done easily. The only complaint I had, is it was hard to put the wheels in all the way. I had to get a rubber mallet and really whack the F out of them to make them go in all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Book Mavin

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I've been wanting!
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted one for these for years and just never did the research to find the best one at the best price. Well I found it. The item was a little scratched up due to the handle moving during shipment. The wringer is very sturdy and should not break unlike many of the reviews claim. I am using this to mop a 1600 ft house with hardwood floors and 1300 ft commercial space with epoxy floors both of them weekly and this mop bucket is working great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken Hardware - Otherwise Fine Product
customer_reviews.text: I just received my new mop bucket. I purposely spent extra money on a heavy duty commercial model so I would not have to replace it in my lifetime. The plastic bucket is well constructed as are the castors and the wringer assembly. I had trouble snapping the handle into place but succeeded after several attempts. I only have one complaint with this purchase: one of the small bolts on the wringer assembly is missing the thread protector. Unfortunately, I am unable to contact the seller. I will have to go straight to the supplier to have a replacement sent to me or just go to the hardware store and fix it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Carl L. Bost Jr.

customer_reviews.title: ... wide lip it shows is not the wide nothing like the picture
customer_reviews.text: Very displeased on the way the picture shows the Bucket The wide lip it shows is not the wide nothing like the picture... tried to return it you cannot return this product ... I am a great customer and believe in Amazon but couldn't believe they wouldn't return it !!
customer_reviews.author: B.  Ched

customer_reviews.title: Unbreakable
customer_reviews.text: The wringer and bucket are unbreakable. I put a ton of weight on the lever and it holds up fine. Used to remove water from clothes washed by hand. The only wish is that it would touch side to side to get every drop out. The bucket has many different ways to lift and carry and pour. The wheels are large and roll easy over braid rug edges. And it's compact. Ordered a mop set to take it even further.
customer_reviews.author: Cimmay

customer_reviews.title: Emergency Clothes Washing System
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, unfortunately, the handle did not fit/work - but that's ok. Because of the emerging global situation with the CoVid-19 outbreak - doing laundry while living in an apartment complex has proved to be a challenge. I had researched using a wringer mop bucket previously (with a 'Breathing Plunger' for laundry use) and this is definitely a solution to rapidly changing circumstances. I'm looking forward to Jehovah God's Promised Global Paradise...where "no one will say, 'I am sick.' " - Isaiah 33:24 (2013 NWT).
customer_reviews.author: C. Maree

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to cleaning my floors at home, this made the project so much EASIER! I love the wheels (no more picking up heavily buckets of water), it maneuvers easily! It is very well made, quality materials. My favorite is the industrial strength wringer! (No more hurting my back!) GREAT DEAL! 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed w/ this mop bucket. First, when I received it it was missing wheel attachment so I can't put it all together properly. I wrote to Amazon for a return & exchange. I received the replacement right away. Then, after 4 months of use the wheel attachment broke off & I couldn't use the bucket anymore! I wanted to buy this mop bucket just because I get to choose a different color other than the normal yellow ones you can get at a warehouse store. And this Carlisle mop bucket wasn't cheap so I was disappointed it broke easily :-/
customer_reviews.author: falfie&spanky

customer_reviews.title: Not wringing water out effectively
customer_reviews.text: I like the color red. I likt that it had wheels. But when pulling handle down with nothing in it. There still was a big gap. So once i placed wet mop to wring out. It did not get it almost dry. 80% of the water was still in mop. Mop was still dripping with water. And i would habe to use my hands to finish wringing out water. Which i can't do, due to disability.
customer_reviews.author: Kay young

customer_reviews.title: Not what the Janitor is Using
customer_reviews.text: I once a janitor. Although this appears to be similar to what they use, it is not. This unit is not a sturdy as those but is still fairly good. I bought this for my home after growing tired of buying cheap residential stuff and it breaking. You will need to use a large size mop head in order for it to ring out the water because the press does not clamp down all the way with a small one . Other than that its pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I wonder why I waited so long to get this! With three kids and three dogs, I mop every day. Also, my entire house has dark hardwood flooring that shows every scuff and piece of hair. This has cut my mopping time in half and saves my back and hands from overworking. It is so easy to use! I bring it room to room and am able to both wring the mop and apply cleaning water right after. I bought it with an industrial mop.
customer_reviews.author: Molly M.

customer_reviews.title: Great if you don't like wheels.
customer_reviews.text: The holes that the wheel casters go into where too big. We used the included inserts to make the holes smaller, but they didn't hold up at all. The very first time we used the handle to squeeze the water out of the mop, the wheels completely buckled underneath. The rest of the bucket is great and as long as my kids are following me around sliding the bucket, it's all good. :) In total fairness, I didn't ask for a replacement because I don't want to have to send it back. The company may be totally great to fix the problem but I haven't bothered.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Great mop bucket
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mop bucket. I have four dogs and don't like the odors they leave behind on our brick patio. I mix up some Clorox and/or Fabuloso and mop up the pee and gushy poop spots. It has been used every day, it squeezes the mop well and rolls around easily. The handle to pick the bucket up is durable and the squeeze mechanism comes off and reattaches to the bucket quite easily.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: assembly required but sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: the bucket is very nice. bright and sturdy. assembly is required for the wheels, they get a little tricky at first BUT easy to do. would be easier if they were screwed in wheels instead. they stay in place and bucket moves smoothly. good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Yessika

customer_reviews.title: Much Better Than the Rubbermaid 28qt, But Woould not Consider Commercial Grade
customer_reviews.text: This one is much better than that Rubbermaid 28qt that breaks in a matter of days. This is great for the home or apartment, but not too sturdy for commercial use. Don't abuse the wringer and it will last you forever.
customer_reviews.author: Michel

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived quickly and in a sturdy brown box. Unpacked it and all items/pieces were present. Super easy to put together- did it all by myself without a mallet. Works like a champ although my two mini dachshunds are suspicious of it(;
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Harris

customer_reviews.title: Handle doesn't fit - ruins 'maneuverability' to move or empty
customer_reviews.text: The metal handle doesn't fit so you can't move the bucket around without using the mop 'squeezer' which always comes out and too hard to find where it fits back on - without handle makes it hard to also empty; spilled whole bucket on floor cause I couldn't use a handle to control pouring dirty water out . . . otherwise it would be a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Papergate

customer_reviews.title: GRATITUDE FOR A TOOL
customer_reviews.text: At 75 years of age with largely linoleum floors, this is such a helpful tool. I find it handy, easy to use, easy to store, and effective in my weekly cleaning. As a mop and bucket experience it is also good exercise. This was a wise purchase for me, and I am very, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Hull

customer_reviews.title: Treat Yourself!
customer_reviews.text: I have old dogs that have occasional accidents, so I daily change the water and keep the bucket bucket parked close by. Very handy indeed.....convenient and easy to use. Well constructed and light.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with the wringer when unboxing....
customer_reviews.text: Dont have an issue with product so far, HOWEVER it did pinch my finger super hard (wouldn't have been able to get it out had I been alone) when I cut the zip ties holding the wringer together. My finger was jammed in the spring. Could end up being a safety issue. Maybe should have warning on zip ties. It looked better after about 20 minutes, but when it first happen I thought my finger had been broken. Just an fyi...
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line!!
customer_reviews.text: Best product by far!! I use it for washing my floors at home. This product and the mop that comes with it are both rock solid!! No more cheap, garbage plastic mops that break and require frequent replacement mop heads. If you're looking for a quality product that is sturdy, effective, reliable and will last you for decades, this is the way to go!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I love that this is a slightly smaller mop bucket for ...
customer_reviews.text: I love that this is a slightly smaller mop bucket for the area that it is being kept in, but it is not commercial grade quality. The mop bucket functions appropriately, but is a bit flimsy where the wringer is attached, so that when you wring out the mop head, the bucket part bends and puts wear on the bucket. I do not know the life-span of this mop bucket in the area where I have it, but for now it is doing the job.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: POOR Design. The mop bucket falls over because it ...
customer_reviews.text: POOR Design. The mop bucket falls over because it is top heavy. The press for the mop does not stay attatched to the mop bucket. I tried to save a few dollars and not buy another Rubbermaid. Unbelievable that anyone can rate this product positively or the company. This is terrible. Stay away. Company will not accept return and difficult to deal with. See if they bother to respond to this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is pretty much exactly what you see here
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty much exactly what you see here. a small amount of assembly (put the wheels on, lock in the handle, and set the wringer on the bucket). No complaints, good sturdy construction, rolls around fine. WYSIWYG.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: Currently have 5 pets, 4 bathrooms, and 3 kitchens. This thing has been very necessary in our house. It saves my back becsause imagine all that cleaning and having to wring the mop with my hands? No way. Very grateful, and it's easy to clean. The wheels roll super easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ready4aNap

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy wringer. Does exactly what it is meant to do. Light weight, but so far it appears that it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Conley

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty mop bucket. It was last a long time. I use it for home use. What would make it a great mop bucket is if it had a clamp for a mop to hold it in place and a drain built in other than that good product.
customer_reviews.author: A and C Twins Mommy

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC for mopping - but WAY TOO EXPENSIVE!
customer_reviews.text: This was REALLY expensive, and it's plastic. It is VERY sturdy and easy to use and makes a simple task of mopping with a big mop, but I think it is grossly overpriced! It's PLASTIC! I bought a Powder Coated STEEL handicap handle for my bathtub for $25, this thing is NOTHING LIKE THAT and was at least twice as expensive.
customer_reviews.author: JanneZack

customer_reviews.title: Love it - especially the red color!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a quality mop bucket since I moved into a house with only hardwood floors. I find this to be a great choice! The day I received it, I clicked all the wheels on and off I went for my first test drive. It navigates around the house easily, quiet swiveling of the wheels... does not tip over easily- credits to my toddler for checking on that! Separates into two pieces without a struggle so it can be cleaned and dried after use.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly smith

customer_reviews.title: Takes me back
customer_reviews.text: Other than feeling like the janitor at my elementary school this is a good product. Sure you can pay more and get a color other than the glaring yellow but then you wouldn't get that same nostalgic feeling . It's big, rolls easily, and gets the mop wrung out just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Public

customer_reviews.title: RECOMMEND - Great product, great price, easy to use, very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great price. Shipped & delivered on time. Some assembly required - but it was super easy and instructions were easy to follow. My 10 year old wanted to out it together, so I said "have at it, kiddo...." and he dove right in and had it together in minutes. Zero complaints about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Charla Brown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the house!
customer_reviews.text: A bit smaller than the large commercial sizes. Perfect size for the house! Sturdy, works great!
customer_reviews.author: ElGrandeDawg

customer_reviews.title: Good for household
customer_reviews.text: Works well for household. Very sturdy. Prior to this bucket, I use to buy Wal Mart mops/buckets, they keep on breaking or not holding up. It’s worth the money, it lasts long.
customer_reviews.author: LiYang

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, professional quality
customer_reviews.text: I needed a solution that would help me not strain my back anymore with toting mop buckets around to mop my floors. This is exactly what I needed for sure! I have no issues because I can just drag, push or pull it around, it happily rolls all around where I need it. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy R Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!! Made mopping soooo easy and quick
customer_reviews.text: This bucket is super easy to use, wrings my mop out very well, so I'm not mopping puddles around. Quality---well made, my husband purchased this for me & I'm so thankful. We originally owned a rubbermaid, it was terrible and did not wring my mop out well. Carlisle is the way to go! I'm a mopping queen now and its so easy to use, my kids can help!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Moon Warp Speed

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: This mop bucket works well and is sturdy. Easy to carry. However, the mop needs to be thick in order for the press to work efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Just like they use in restaurants
customer_reviews.text: This is a standard industrial mop wringer and bucket. Works just like the ones they use in restaurants, but I bought it to use at home. Much more effective than other alternatives I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Tate

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Just like the ones they use at restaurants and schools.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben A Cortez

customer_reviews.title: Good for home use.
customer_reviews.text: Have not used it yet. Easy to assemble. Seems sturdy enough for regular house use. We have about 1,200 sq ft of linoleum and I think for us this will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S.

customer_reviews.title: Best mop bucket combo imo
customer_reviews.text: Glad i got this... i have all the smaller mops but they never get my floors as clean. Compared to those smaller mops this way more efficient use of time also.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big enough ... for small business
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid Mop Bucket and handle ... It does have a smaller bucket and mop wringer than expected Its NOT the traditional size that most businesses would have
customer_reviews.author: Froggy

customer_reviews.title: Good product, booby-trapped packaging
customer_reviews.text: This mop bucket with wringer seems just fine, but it was packed with the wringer handle ziptied down and when I cut the ziptie the handle smacked me in the face really hard and gave me a black eye.
customer_reviews.author: Miep Rowan O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Janitor ho!
customer_reviews.text: Buy this- last mop bucket u will ever need! Add up all the crap buckets my wife or i have bought, and the $49 for this ... no brainer. Now u too can have the power of a custodian in your own home!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Showed up with a screw missing on one of the rods on the wringer
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent
customer_reviews.text: The product seems very sturdy and moves around very easily. My only complaint is it doesn't wring out the mop enough. The mop still comes out with more water than I would want.
customer_reviews.author: judy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, good product.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Wringer is strong enough to drain mop head. Bucket is not too heavy and all 4 wheels work well. It’s 26-qt so smaller compare to standard 35-qt. It works perfectly in my commercial kitchen and mop sink room.
customer_reviews.author: Yoyopan

customer_reviews.title: Good bucket size for small apartments or houses
customer_reviews.text: Great for small apartments or ranch style homes. The wheels moves easily unlike some other mop buckets ive used. For bigger houses like 2 story homes or facilities id recommend a bigger gallon size or you will be replacing the water often.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mop bucket
customer_reviews.text: It's a sturdy mop bucket that does the job. I appreciate that it has a warning wet floor sign on the side of the bucket. I have been using for almost a year and it has held up great. I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Filogomo

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: My first time in use I spilled 5 gallon's of soapy water on a custom floor , the bucket appears sturdy but is a little top heavy I believe , when I pulled it it tipped over , it's ok for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty

customer_reviews.title: The wheels are bad
customer_reviews.text: The wheels on this are not good and make it hard to move around. I'm constantly having to fight it to make it go where I want. Other than that, the build quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt D.

customer_reviews.title: Best unit for the money
customer_reviews.text: Best unit for the money. I sometimes take the wringer off and place it on my garage sink. Good value. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Dougnverde

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: My husband love to mop the floor now. And I’m loving it. I should buy it before. Buy a Mop with a flat shape. Not too big bucket, good for a small house or apartment. Good quality material, and strong. True little dark red color mine.
customer_reviews.author: Marielis

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t buy
customer_reviews.text: You can’t even squeeze the mop, I feel like the whole bucket is going to break.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: high quality mop bucket
customer_reviews.text: finally the right tool for the job , perfect for a small apt . thanks to the reviews I knew exactly what preventive measures to take when I got it , smear Vaseline all over the springs , nuts and bolts stopped the squeaky spring right away .Best thing I bought all year , I got it dirt cheap too
customer_reviews.author: C. Stacker

customer_reviews.title: Definitely goes on your bucket list.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good tool. Seems sturdy so far. The wringer could be a little bigger, you have to finesse a large mop head into it. The casters roll smoothly, however they are a little challenging to install. The are supposed to "press fit" but - its a wheel - push on it and it spins and your hand shoots off into the sharp edge of the bucket.
customer_reviews.author: Flybob

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great mop bucket easy to maneuver. Only issue is with the squeeze mechanism I need to twist the mop in order to really ring the head out.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: very well built
customer_reviews.text: this thing is strong. I was afraid it wouldn't be able to handle tight squeezes on the mop head, but it did fine. Also, just small enough to be able to pick up the bucket and dump it outside.
customer_reviews.author: Seymour Gomez

customer_reviews.title: I needed a good Commercial quality mop bucket because I was tired of ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good Commercial quality mop bucket because I was tired of the throw away junk stuff at walmart and target. This mop bucket will last for many many years.
customer_reviews.author: Mhouser7

customer_reviews.title: Good value; I think it will last a long time for household chores
customer_reviews.text: This is a good value. I think it will last along time around the house. The mop squisher mechanism seems strong enough for regular household tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ross

customer_reviews.title: Generally good product. Could be great if....
customer_reviews.text: All said, it is a good unit. My only issue is that when you ring the mop out, the side wall of the bucket flexes more than I think it should. They should make that side more sturdy. Wheels maneuver wonderfully!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Lobisser

customer_reviews.title: Broke after first use
customer_reviews.text: The plastic caster broke on one is the wheels after first use. Now I can’t use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Good little mop bucket. I have had no problems whatsoever with its use or cleaning. Saved me lots of time and energy cleaning up behind my rescue animals. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: CinderellaRN

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Perfect mop bucket because it wrings out the mop so good. Great to have because I have RA and can no longer squeeze the water out of the mop. It really does a great job wringing the mop out. One of my favorite purchases to help me with my housework.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Burnam

customer_reviews.title: I saw the complaints about the wheels coming off. ...
customer_reviews.text: I saw the complaints about the wheels coming off. If they do, it means they weren't pounded in all the way. My husband used a ratchet wrench to get as close to the center as possible and then hammered hard until the wheel just wouldn't go any further. My attempt with the rubber mallet did not get them in far enough and of course the wheels came off.
customer_reviews.author: BEB

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Guess what!? It’s a big ole mop bucket, and it works just like a big ole mop bucket should!
customer_reviews.author: Kel

customer_reviews.title: great for medium sized jobs
customer_reviews.text: I always tell my staff: the mop bucket is a Washing Machine for the mop. A mop bucket must be FULL of CLEAN water (and solution) to make a clean floor. This requires changing the water more often for larger spaces or dirtier spaces. This bucket is the right size to handle, weight wise and does have strong construction and good caster wheels. I thought it was a bit expensive, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: K9xprt

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. Easy for us to push around in our house. Very fast shipping. Was cheaper than Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Sahara

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, sturdy, heavy-duty large bucket!
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy mop bucket. Works fantastic! Very easy to move around! I recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: J. Priester

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small, at home uses
customer_reviews.text: Great little tub and squisher. As sturdy as any janitor's mop bucket system, but slightly smaller for at home use.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Binkowski

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the apartment. Looked at the traditional yellow ones first but since we live in an apartment, this would be a better size. We are able to store it without taking up a lot of room.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I like my new mop bucket! It's very sturdy and rolls well. Works exactly as it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Ittlepookterville

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly as stable as a metal bucket, but more practical. Perfect for mopping a large mess and quickly mopping out a garage floor.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Great price, great product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I need it at home because I don't like have to wring out a mop by hand. I've used commercial mop buckets in the past but they were always a bit pricey. This mop bucket does the job at a reasonable price. It's great for the homeowner or even apartment dweller.
customer_reviews.author: Aelf

customer_reviews.title: Good, a few suggestions/warnings
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and fairly well made. When wet mop head is in the strainer and you pull down, you can knock the whole bucket over if you're not careful. The bucket was not designed with a splash guard wall, which helps prevent water spilling over the side. So you need to stop carefully while rolling a bucket full of soapy water.
customer_reviews.author: ZacharyMH

product_meta.title: Carlisle 3690869 Commercial Mop Bucket with Side Press Wringer, 26 Quart Capacity, Brown
product_meta.description:
Size:26 Quart| Color:Brown

This Carlisle 3690869 brown 26-qt. capacity mop bucket has a compact design and a side-press wringer to extract excess liquid from a mop and funnel the liquid back into the basin. The bucket and wringer are made of polyethylene for durability and corrosion resistance, and have four non-marking casters for mobility. The bucket is 13-1/4" high, the wringer is 23" high, and the top of the handle is 34-1/4" high. The overall dimensions of the item are 18-1/2 x 16-1/2 inches (length x width).

Carlisle manufactures food service equipment and supplies and sanitary maintenance tools and supplies for commercial, industrial, and institutional facilities. The company, founded in 1954, is headquartered in Oklahoma City, OK.
feature_bullets: 50,000 Cycles Wringer - Side Press wring is easy to use and is designed to perform up to 50,000 wringing cycles for heavy-duty mopping
Color-Coded System – Colored buckets can be used in conjunction with a color-coded system to identify or designate specific cleaning areas or chemicals and support HACCP and SQF programs
Effortless Mobility – 4 non-marking swivel casters make the toughest jobs easier by minimizing the effort of transporting large volumes of liquid over any floor type
Durable Construction – Corrosion-resistant polyethylene can withstand temperatures from -40°F to 180°F for reliability and long-term use
Compact Design – Provides storage convenience for tight-fitting environments

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
